metadata.titleEn: Glacier coverage data on the Tibetan Plateau in 2001 (TPG2001, Version1.0)
metadata.description: The Tibetan Plateau Glacial Data –TPG2001 is a glacial coverage data on the Tibetan Plateau in around 2000 from 150 scenes of Landsat7 TM/ETM+ images by 30 m spatial resolution. The selected Landsat7 TM/ETM+ images were within the period between 1999 and 2002, including 61 scenes (41%) in 2001 and 47 scenes (31%) in 2000. Among all the images, 71% was taken in winter. The most frequent year in this period was defined as the reference year for the mosaic image: i.e. 2001. Glacier outlines were digitized on-screen manually from the 2001 image mosaic, relying on false-colour image composites (RGB by bands 543), which allowed us to distinguish ice/snow from cloud. Debris-free ice was distinguished from the debris and debris-covered ice by its higher reflectance. Debris-covered ice was not delineated in this data. The delineated glacier outlines were compared with band-ratio (e.g. TM3/TM5) results, and validated by overlapping them onto Google Earth imagery, SRTM DEM, topographic maps and corresponding satellite images. Topographic maps from the 1970s and all available satellite images (including Google EarthTM imagery) were used as base reference data. For areas with mountain shadows and snow cover, they were verified by different methods using data from different seasons. For glaciers in deep shadow, Google EarthTM imagery from different dates was used as the reference for manual delineation. Steep slopes or headwalls were also excluded in the TPG2001. Areas that appeared in any of these sources to have the characteristics of exposed ground/basement/bed rock were manually delineated as non-glacier, and were also cross-checked with CGI-1 and CGI-2. Steep hanging glaciers were included in TPG2001 if they were identifiable on images in all three epochs (i.e. TPG1976, TPG2001, and TPG2013). The accuracy of manual digitization was controlled within one half-pixel. All glacier areas were calculated on the WGS84 spheroid in an Albers equal-area map projection centred at (95°E, 30°N) with standard parallels at 15°N and 65°N. Our results showed that the relative deviation of manual interpretation was less than 3.8%.
metadata.descriptionCn:
本数据集是2001年青藏高原冰川数据，使用了150景Landsat7 TM/ETM+卫星多光谱遥感数据，时间主要从1999年至2002年，72%来源于2000/2001年，71%遥感数据成像于冬季。冰川数据是青藏高原净冰川覆盖范围，不包括表碛物覆盖部分。数据格式是TIFF，可以为青藏高原冰川变化、冰川水文研究提供基础数据支持。
数据内容：冰川编号FID_smglac，基于Albers等积圆锥投影计算的冰川面积area_km2，所在流域在我国冰川编目中冰川流域的二级编码code, 所在流域在我国冰川编目中冰川流域一级编码First_code,所在流域中文名称name，所在流域英文名称Ename,冰川斑块周长Peremeter(km)，斑块中心点X坐标（decimal degree）, 斑块中心点Y坐标（decimal degree）。
格网单元：30m
数据的投影方式：Albers等积圆锥投影。
数据加工方法：基于150景Landsat7 TM(ETM+）卫星数据，校正、镶嵌为假彩色合成影像（TM/ETM+， RGB:543），采用人工目视解译方法，参考波段比值法结果，结合SRTM DEM V4.1数据与Google Earth 同一年不同季节的影像，剔除了山体阴影、季节性积雪的影响，参考我国第一期和第二期冰川编目数据，剔除了非冰川区的陡崖、裸露基岩等，综合提取净冰川专题矢量数据，不包括冰川末端位置不清的表碛物覆盖区域，冰川边界数字化精度为半个像元（15m）。通过对比分析，可知基于多数据源、参考多方法结果、综合专家经验知识人-机互动方法提取获得的山地冰川矢量数据更准确。具体数据提取方法详见参考文献：
Ye, Q., J.Zong,L.Tian et al. (2017). Glacier changes on the Tibetan Plateau derived from Landsat imagery: mid-1970s – 2000 – 2013. Journal of Glaciology,63(238), 273-87. DOI:10.1017/jog.2016.137
原始遥感资料数据精度：30m。
数据质量控制措施：冰川边界数字化精度控制在半个像元之内（15m）。
加工后数据精度：TPG2001总体数据误差在3.8%。
项目来源：中国科学院战略性先导科技专项（A类）（XDA19070302），第二次青藏高原综合科学考察研究资助（2019QZKK0202），中国科学院“十三五”信息化建设专项资助(XXH13505-06)，国家自然科学基金项目（41530748, 91747201）。

background: Nearly all mountain glaciers have been melting rapidly in recent decades (Gardner and others, 2013; Zemp and others, 2015) and this has been documented, especially in High Mountain Asia (HMA hereafter), in surveys of the whole (Li and others, 2008; Cogley, 2016) or large parts (Bolch and others, 2012; Yao and others, 2012) of the region as well as in basin-scale and single-glacier studies (Fujita and Nuimura, 2011; Wang and others, 2013; Yang and others, 2013). As reported in these earlier studies, most HMA glaciers showed obvious shrinkage (area loss) and thinning (implying mass loss) except in the west, for example in the Karakoram (Gardelle and others, 2012) and western Kunlun (Neckel and others, 2014; Kääb and others, 2015; Ke and others, 2015). However, due to strong spatiotemporal differences of climate variability and topographic effects, the magnitudes of glacier shrinkage have varied in space and time. The TP, defined by outlines from Zhang and others (2014), can be divided into two categories of hydrological unit, the outlines and basin codes of which we take from Shi and others (2008). Generally, meltwater from glaciers in IB flows into inland depressions, while those in EC flow into the ocean and so contribute more directly to sea-level rise. Climatically, the Indian monsoon dominates in the southeastern TP in summer (e.g. in 5O, 5N, 5L), with some effects from the East Asian monsoon in the east (e.g. in 5Y4, 5J, 5K). The westerlies are dominant in winter, especially in the western TP (e.g. 5Y6, 5Z4, 5Z3). Regions in the interior TP, such as 5Z1, 5Z2, 5Z5, 5Z6 and 5Y5 are less influenced both by the summer monsoon and the westerlies (Yao and others, 2012).
research objective: In this study, we present debris-free glacier area changes and their spatial heterogeneity at the plateau scale from the 1970s to 2013 based on three mosaic Landsat images, i.e. in the 1970s (TPG1970s), TPG2001 and TPG2013. Another purpose of the study is to enrich the available collection of glacier inventories in HMA, by presenting a detailed comparison of TPG datasets with previous glacier inventories.
challenges: We were unable to remove debris-covered areas from the GAMDAM inventory (GGI) (Nuimura and others, 2015), which includes debris cover but does not distinguish it from debris-free ice. Obviously snow and clouds could have affected glacier delineation, especially in southeastern Tibet where cloudy days are rather frequent in every season. Nor is it likely that the area differences are due to different treatment of debris cover, which is omitted in TGP2001 and included in GAMDAM.
methods: Glacier outlines (TPG1976, TPG2001 and TPG2013) were digitized manually with guidance from the SRTM DEM v4.1 and Google Earth imagery. To achieve complete multi-temporal coverage in a reasonable time, only debris-free ice was delineated. Time series of Landsat scenes were processed with Standard Terrain Correction (Level 1T), which provided systematic radiometric and geometric accuracy by incorporating ground control points while employing SRTM DEM for topographic accuracy. High-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage were selected for the delineation of glaciers. Glacier outlines were digitized on-screen manually from the three image mosaics, relying on false-colour image composites (MSS: red, green and blue (RGB) represented by bands 321; TM/ETM+: RGB by bands 543, OLI: RGB by bands 654), which allowed us to distinguish ice and snow from cloud. The manual delineation was carried out by three operators over a period of 6 years. The delineated glacier outlines were validated and edited by different operators at least three times by overlaying them onto Google Earth imagery, DEMs, topographic maps and corresponding satellite images by another two glacier researchers with field survey experience.
dataset: Glacier area on the plateau decreased from 44 366 ± 2827 km2 (1.7% of the study area) in the 1970s to 42 210 ± 1621 km2 in 2001 and 41 137 ± 1616 km2 in 2013.
findings: The comparative analysis of three mosaics shows that glacier area loss across the entire Tibetan Plateau is unequivocal. The glaciers in the M1970-76 subset showed shrinkage at−0.19% a−1 during 1976– 2001 and −0.20% a−1 during 2001– 13. Glaciers in the M1970-88 subset shrank at −0.34% a−1 during 1988 – 2013, and in the M1970-94 subset at −0.42% a−1 during 1994– 2013. The most dramatic glacier shrinkage occurred in the Mekong basin (region 5L) in the southeast, with change rates for M1970s-76 glaciers of −0.43% a−1 during 1976 – 2013 (−0.31% a−1 during 1976– 2001 and −0.73% a−1 during 2001– 13). Glaciers in the western and northern Tibetan Plateau changed at the slowest rates: −0.12% a−1 in 5Y6, −0.14% a−1 in 5Z1, −0.17% a−1 in 5Y5 and −0.17% a−1 in 5Z5 from 1976 to 2013. Overall, glaciers in externally drained catchments showed more dramatic shrinkage than those in the internally drained catchments. This shows a spatial gradient across the plateau of glacier shrinkage rate, decreasing from the southeast to the north and the west.
backgroundCn: 近年来，几乎所有的山地冰川都在快速融化（Gardner 等，2013；Zemp 等，2015），这一现象在高山亚洲（以下简称 HMA）得到了特别的记录，包括对整个地区（Li 等，2008；Cogley，2016）或大部分地区（Bolch 等，2012；Yao 等，2012）的调查，以及流域规模和单个冰川的研究（Fujita 和 Nuimura，2011；Wang 等，2013；Yang 等，2013）。早期研究报告显示，大多数 HMA 冰川明显缩小（面积损失）和变薄（意味着质量损失），但在西部地区，例如喀喇昆仑山（Gardelle 等，2012）和西昆仑山（Neckel 等，2014；Kääb 等，2015；Ke 等，2015）则有所不同。然而，由于气候变异和地形效应的强烈时空差异，冰川缩小的幅度在空间和时间上有所不同。根据 Zhang 等（2014）的轮廓，青藏高原（TP）可以分为两类水文单元，其轮廓和流域代码取自 Shi 等（2008）。一般来说，内陆流域（IB）中的冰川融水流入内陆洼地，而东部流域（EC）中的冰川融水则流入海洋，因此更直接地对海平面上升产生影响。在气候上，印度季风在东南 TP 的夏季占主导地位（例如在 5O、5N、5L），而东亚季风在东部也有一些影响（例如在 5Y4、5J、5K）。西风带在冬季占主导地位，尤其是在西部 TP（例如 5Y6、5Z4、5Z3）。青藏高原内部的地区，如 5Z1、5Z2、5Z5、5Z6 和 5Y5，受到夏季季风和西风带的影响较小（Yao 等，2012）。
research objectiveCn: 在本研究中，我们基于三幅马赛克的Landsat影像（即1970年代的TPG1970s、TPG2001和TPG2013），展示了1970年代至2013年间无碎屑冰川面积变化及其在高原尺度上的空间异质性。研究的另一个目的是通过对TPG数据集与之前的冰川清单进行详细比较，丰富喜马拉雅地区现有的冰川清单。
challengesCn: 我们无法从GAMDAM库存（GGI）中去除覆盖 debris 的区域（Nuimura 等，2015），该库存包括 debris 覆盖，但未将其与无 debris 冰区区分开来。显然，雪和云可能影响冰川的划分，特别是在西南藏区，那里在每个季节都有相当频繁的阴天。面积差异也不太可能是由于对 debris 覆盖的不同处理造成的，因为 TGP2001 中省略了 debris 覆盖，而 GAMDAM 中则包含了它。
methodsCn: 冰川轮廓（TPG1976、TPG2001 和 TPG2013）是通过手动数字化的，参考了 SRTM DEM v4.1 和 Google Earth 图像。为了在合理的时间内实现完整的多时相覆盖，仅对无碎石的冰体进行了划定。处理的 Landsat 场景时间序列经过标准地形校正（Level 1T），通过结合地面控制点并采用 SRTM DEM 提供了系统的辐射和几何精度，以确保地形精度。选择了高质量、云层和雪覆盖最少的图像用于冰川的划定。冰川轮廓是通过在三个图像马赛克上手动数字化的，依赖于假彩色图像合成（MSS：红、绿和蓝（RGB）由波段 321 表示；TM/ETM+：RGB 由波段 543 表示；OLI：RGB 由波段 654 表示），这使我们能够区分冰雪与云。手动划定工作由三名操作员在六年内进行。划定的冰川轮廓经过不同操作员至少三次验证和编辑，方法是将其叠加到 Google Earth 图像、DEM、地形图和相应的卫星图像上，由另外两名具有实地调查经验的冰川研究人员进行审核。
datasetCn: 高原上的冰川面积从1970年代的44,366 ± 2,827平方公里（占研究区域的1.7%）减少到2001年的42,210 ± 1,621平方公里，以及2013年的41,137 ± 1,616平方公里。
findingsCn: 三幅马赛克的比较分析表明，整个青藏 Plateau的冰川面积损失是无可否认的。在M1970-76子集中的冰川在1976年至2001年间的收缩率为−0.19% a−1，在2001年至2013年间为−0.20% a−1。M1970-88子集中的冰川在1988年至2013年间的收缩率为−0.34% a−1，而在M1970-94子集中的冰川在1994年至2013年间的收缩率为−0.42% a−1。最显著的冰川收缩发生在东南部的湄公河流域（5L区域），M1970s-76冰川在1976年至2013年间的变化率为−0.43% a−1（1976年至2001年为−0.31% a−1，2001年至2013年为−0.73% a−1）。青藏 Plateau西部和北部的冰川变化速率最慢：在5Y6区域为−0.12% a−1，在5Z1区域为−0.14% a−1，在5Y5区域和5Z5区域均为−0.17% a−1，从1976年到2013年。总体而言，外排水流域的冰川收缩比内排水流域的冰川更为显著。这显示出冰川收缩速率在青藏 Plateau上存在空间梯度，从东南部向北部和西部递减。

Verification.QuestionEn: Does the data collection method for glacier data on the Tibetan Plateau involve manual digitization of glacier outlines?
Verification.QuestionCn: 对青藏高原冰川数据的收集方法是否涉及冰川轮廓的手动数字化？

Verification.QuestionEn: Is the accuracy of the data collection method verified through comparison with imagery from multiple sources such as Google Earth and DEMs?
Verification.QuestionCn: 数据收集方法的准确性是否通过与来自多个来源（如谷歌地球和数字高程模型）的影像进行比较来验证？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the primary method for glacier data extraction based on manual digitization, automated algorithms, or a combination of both?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 冰川数据提取的主要方法是基于手动数字化、自动算法，还是两者的结合？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the challenges most pronounced when delineating glaciers on the Tibetan Plateau using remote sensing data?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在使用遥感数据划定青藏高原上的冰川时，挑战最明显的地方在哪里？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: When did the glacier area on the Tibetan Plateau undergo the most significant shrinkage, according to Landsat imagery analysis?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 根据Landsat影像分析，青藏高原的冰川面积在何时经历了最显著的缩减？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to delineate glacier outlines on the Tibetan Plateau from satellite imagery?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于从卫星影像中划定青藏高原冰川轮廓的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: One data collection method involved digitizing glacier outlines manually using false-color image composites from Landsat satellite imagery. This process included using Standard Terrain Correction to ensure radiometric and geometric accuracy, and employed SRTM DEM for topographic accuracy. The manual delineation was validated and edited by multiple operators using Google Earth imagery, DEMs, topographic maps, and corresponding satellite images.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及使用来自Landsat卫星影像的假彩色图像合成手动数字化冰川轮廓。该过程包括使用标准地形校正以确保辐射和几何精度，并采用SRTM数字高程模型（DEM）以确保地形精度。手动划定经过多个操作员的验证和编辑，使用了Google Earth影像、DEM、地形图和相应的卫星图像。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that illustrates glacier area changes on the Tibetan Plateau over multiple decades?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个示例数据集，说明青藏高原上冰川面积在多个十年间的变化？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is the one showing glacier area changes from the 1970s to 2013 on the Tibetan Plateau. It indicates that the glacier area decreased from 44,366 ± 2,827 km² in the 1970s to 42,210 ± 1,621 km² in 2001 and further to 41,137 ± 1,616 km² in 2013, illustrating a clear trend of glacier shrinkage over the decades.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是显示1970年代到2013年间青藏高原冰川面积变化的数据。数据显示，1970年代冰川面积为44,366 ± 2,827 km²，到2001年减少到42,210 ± 1,621 km²，进一步到2013年减少到41,137 ± 1,616 km²，清楚地表明了几十年来冰川缩小的趋势。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What methodological challenges are involved in delineating glaciers from satellite imagery?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 从卫星图像中划定冰川面临哪些方法论挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: inability to remove debris-covered areas, presence of snow and clouds, requires careful validation and editing by multiple operators, difficulties distinguishing between ice, snow, and cloud in false-color composites
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 无法清除覆盖碎片的区域，存在积雪和云层，需要多个操作员仔细验证和编辑，在假彩色合成图中难以区分冰、雪和云。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the grid cell resolution used for capturing glacier data on the Tibetan Plateau?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 用于捕捉青藏高原冰川数据的网格单元分辨率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the overall data processing error percentage reported for the glacier dataset from 2001?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 2001年冰川数据集报告的整体数据处理错误百分比是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many Landsat images were used in the creation of the glacier dataset for the Tibetan Plateau in 2001?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在2001年，为青藏 Plateau 创建冰川数据集使用了多少幅Landsat影像？

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with delineating debris-covered glaciers in satellite imagery, and how are they addressed in data collection methods?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在卫星影像中划定覆盖碎石的冰川面临哪些挑战，以及在数据收集方法中如何解决这些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Delineating debris-covered glaciers is challenging because debris can obscure glacier boundaries, making it difficult to distinguish between debris-covered ice and surrounding landscapes. In the dataset collection, this challenge is addressed by excluding debris-covered areas from the glacier outlines, focusing only on debris-free ice, and using high-quality imagery with minimal clouds and snow for accurate delineation.
Definition.AnswerCn: delineating debris-covered glaciers is challenging because debris can obscure glacier boundaries, making it difficult to distinguish between debris-covered ice and surrounding landscapes. In the dataset collection, this challenge is addressed by excluding debris-covered areas from the glacier outlines, focusing only on debris-free ice, and using high-quality imagery with minimal clouds and snow for accurate delineation.

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of removing debris-covered areas affect the accuracy of glacier datasets compared to datasets that only include debris-free ice?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 去除覆盖碎石区域的挑战如何影响冰川数据集的准确性，与仅包含无碎石冰的数据显示相比？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets that focus only on debris-free ice, like those derived from TPG2001, avoid the inaccuracies associated with failing to distinguish debris from ice, a challenge faced by other inventories such as GAMDAM, which includes but does not distinguish debris-covered areas.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 专注于无碎屑冰的数据库，如TPG2001衍生的数据集，避免了未能区分碎屑与冰所带来的不准确性，这是其他数据库（如GAMDAM）面临的挑战，后者包括但不区分碎屑覆盖区域。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the spatial coverage and temporal scope of glacier datasets using Landsat imagery compare to other remote sensing data sources for studying glacier changes over time?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用Landsat影像的冰川数据集的空间覆盖和时间范围与其他遥感数据源在研究冰川变化方面的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The glacier datasets based on Landsat imagery provide comprehensive multi-temporal coverage, enabling detailed analysis of changes from the 1970s to 2013. This temporal scope may offer advantages over other remote sensing sources that might lack consistent longitudinal data or the spatial resolution provided by the Landsat series.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 基于Landsat影像的冰川数据集提供了全面的多时相覆盖，能够详细分析从1970年代到2013年的变化。这一时间范围可能相较于其他遥感源具有优势，因为其他源可能缺乏一致的纵向数据或Landsat系列所提供的空间分辨率。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the challenges of distinguishing debris-covered ice from debris-free ice in glacier datasets, and how might these challenges affect data accuracy?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断出在冰川数据集中区分覆盖碎屑的冰与无碎屑的冰的挑战，以及这些挑战如何影响数据准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The inability to remove debris-covered areas from certain glacier inventories suggests challenges in accurately delineating glacier boundaries, especially in areas with frequent cloud cover. This can affect the accuracy of glacier area measurements and lead to discrepancies between different datasets.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 无法从某些冰川清单中去除覆盖 debris 的区域，表明在准确划定冰川边界方面存在挑战，尤其是在云层覆盖频繁的地区。这可能会影响冰川面积测量的准确性，并导致不同数据集之间的差异。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of multiple data sources and methods contribute to the accuracy and reliability of glacier data collection?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多种数据源和方法的整合如何有助于冰川数据收集的准确性和可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of multiple data sources, such as Landsat imagery, SRTM DEM, and Google Earth, combined with methods like manual delineation and expert validation, can enhance the precision of glacier boundary extraction by mitigating the impact of factors like seasonal snow cover and mountain shadows.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用多种数据源，如Landsat影像、SRTM数字高程模型和谷歌地球，结合手动划定和专家验证等方法，可以通过减轻季节性雪盖和山影等因素的影响，提高冰川边界提取的精度。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the impact of climate variability and topographic effects on the spatial heterogeneity of glacier changes across the Tibetan Plateau?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 关于气候变率和地形效应对青藏高原冰川变化空间异质性的影响，可以推断出什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The variations in glacier shrinkage rates across different regions of the Tibetan Plateau suggest that climate variability and topographic effects play significant roles in influencing glacier dynamics, resulting in spatially heterogeneous patterns of glacier area loss.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 青藏 Plateau 不同地区的冰川缩小速率差异表明，气候变异性和地形效应在影响冰川动态方面发挥了重要作用，导致冰川面积损失呈现空间异质性模式。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in accurately removing debris-covered areas when digitizing glacier outlines from satellite imagery?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在从卫星影像中数字化冰川轮廓时，准确去除覆盖 debris 的区域所面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges arise because certain inventories, like GAMDAM, include debris cover but do not distinguish it from debris-free ice, complicating delineation. Additionally, frequent cloud cover and snow, particularly in southeastern Tibet, can obscure glacier features, adding to the difficulty.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 挑战出现是因为某些清单，如GAMDAM，包含了碎片覆盖，但没有将其与无碎片冰区区分开来，这使得划分变得复杂。此外，特别是在西南藏地区，频繁的云层和雪会遮挡冰川特征，增加了难度。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the spatial gradient of glacier shrinkage rates observed across the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致青藏 Plateau 冰川缩小速率空间梯度的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The spatial gradient is influenced by climatic variations, with externally drained catchments experiencing more dramatic shrinkage than internally drained ones. The regional climate, dominated by the Indian and East Asian monsoons in the southeast and westerlies in the west, affects glacier melting rates, resulting in a gradient from southeast to north and west.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 空间梯度受到气候变化的影响，外排水流域的缩减比内排水流域更为显著。区域气候受东南部的印度和东亚季风以及西部的西风影响，导致冰川融化速率的梯度从东南向北和西部变化。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using multi-source data and human expertise in glacier data extraction on the accuracy of glacier delineation in the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用多源数据和人类专业知识进行冰川数据提取对青藏高原冰川划界准确性的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of multi-source data and human expertise can enhance the accuracy of glacier delineation, as it allows for the integration of various data types and expert knowledge, resulting in more precise glacier vector data. Specifically, it helps in eliminating non-glacial features such as mountain shadows and seasonal snow, and ensures that glacier boundaries are digitized with high precision, within half a pixel (15m).
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 多源数据和人类专业知识的结合可以提高冰川划界的准确性，因为它允许整合各种数据类型和专家知识，从而生成更精确的冰川矢量数据。具体而言，它有助于消除非冰川特征，如山影和季节性雪，并确保冰川边界以高精度（半个像素，即15米）进行数字化。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of creating a dataset using Landsat imagery for studying glacier changes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 创建使用Landsat影像的数据库以研究青藏高原冰川变化的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to present debris-free glacier area changes and their spatial heterogeneity at the plateau scale from the 1970s to 2013, and to enrich the available collection of glacier inventories in High Mountain Asia by providing a detailed comparison with previous inventories.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是展示1970年代至2013年间无碎屑冰川面积变化及其在高原尺度上的空间异质性，并通过与之前的冰川清单进行详细比较，丰富高山亚洲现有的冰川清单资料。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to differentiate between debris-covered and debris-free ice in datasets related to glacier studies in High Mountain Asia?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在与高山亚洲冰川研究相关的数据集中，区分覆盖碎石的冰和无碎石的冰是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Differentiating between debris-covered and debris-free ice is important because it helps in accurately delineating glacier outlines, which is crucial for understanding glacier shrinkage and changes. Debris cover can obscure the true extent of glaciers, leading to inaccuracies in glacier inventories.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 区分有碎屑覆盖和无碎屑的冰非常重要，因为这有助于准确划定冰川的轮廓，这对于理解冰川的缩小和变化至关重要。碎屑覆盖可能会掩盖冰川的真实范围，从而导致冰川清单的不准确。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to manually digitize glacier outlines using Landsat imagery and ensure their accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 使用Landsat影像手动数字化冰川轮廓并确保其准确性需要遵循哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Glacier outlines are digitized manually using guidance from SRTM DEM v4.1 and Google Earth imagery. The manual delineation is carried out by three operators over a period of six years. Glacier outlines are validated and edited by different operators at least three times by overlaying them onto Google Earth imagery, DEMs, topographic maps, and corresponding satellite images, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 冰川轮廓是通过参考SRTM DEM v4.1和谷歌地球影像手动数字化的。手动划定工作由三名操作员在六年内进行。冰川轮廓经过不同操作员至少三次验证和编辑，方法是将其叠加到谷歌地球影像、数字高程模型（DEM）、地形图和相应的卫星图像上，以确保准确性和一致性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can multi-temporal Landsat scenes be processed to minimize cloud and snow coverage for glacier delineation?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何处理多时相的Landsat影像，以最小化云和雪的覆盖，从而进行冰川划界？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Time series of Landsat scenes are processed with Standard Terrain Correction (Level 1T) to provide systematic radiometric and geometric accuracy. High-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage are selected for the delineation of glaciers, utilizing false-color image composites to distinguish ice and snow from cloud.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 时间序列的Landsat影像经过标准地形校正（Level 1T）处理，以提供系统的辐射和几何精度。选择高质量的影像，尽量减少云和雪的覆盖，以便利用假彩色图像合成来区分冰雪与云。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What techniques enable the accurate delineation of glacier boundaries in remote sensing datasets used for studying the Tibetan Plateau glaciers?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术能够准确划定用于研究青藏高原冰川的遥感数据集中的冰川边界？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The accurate delineation of glacier boundaries is enabled by the manual digitization of glacier outlines using satellite imagery, such as Landsat scenes, which are processed with Standard Terrain Correction for radiometric and geometric accuracy. This process involves the use of false-colour image composites and guidance from SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery, with validation and editing by multiple operators with field survey experience.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 冰川边界的准确划定是通过使用卫星影像（如Landsat场景）手动数字化冰川轮廓来实现的，这些影像经过标准地形校正处理，以确保辐射和几何精度。该过程涉及使用假彩色图像合成，并参考SRTM数字高程模型和谷歌地球影像，由多位具有实地调查经验的操作员进行验证和编辑。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or technologies facilitate the exclusion of debris-covered areas in glacier inventories for high mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或技术可以促进在高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）中排除覆盖碎屑的冰川清单区域？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The exclusion of debris-covered areas in glacier inventories is facilitated by the manual delineation of debris-free ice using high-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage, as well as careful validation using different imagery sources. However, challenges remain in removing debris-covered areas from certain inventories, as manual delineation focuses primarily on debris-free ice.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在冰川清单中排除覆盖碎屑的区域是通过使用高质量的图像（具有最小的云层和雪覆盖）手动划定无碎屑冰的区域来实现的，并通过不同的影像来源进行仔细验证。然而，在某些清单中去除覆盖碎屑的区域仍然面临挑战，因为手动划定主要集中在无碎屑冰上。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might debris-covered glaciers be challenging to accurately delineate in remote sensing datasets?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 碎石覆盖的冰川在遥感数据集中准确划分可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Debris-covered areas can be difficult to remove from inventories as they are often indistinguishable from debris-free ice in certain datasets, and snow or clouds can further affect glacier delineation, especially in regions with frequent cloudy conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 覆盖碎屑的区域在从库存中移除时可能会很困难，因为在某些数据集中，它们常常与无碎屑的冰难以区分，而雪或云层也会进一步影响冰川的划定，尤其是在频繁多云的地区。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What factors could contribute to the varying rates of glacier shrinkage across different regions in the Tibetan Plateau?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 导致青藏高原不同地区冰川缩小速率差异的因素有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The spatial heterogeneity of glacier shrinkage rates could be influenced by climate variability, topographic effects, and the presence of different hydrological units that affect how meltwater contributes to sea-level rise or local depressions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 冰川缩小速率的空间异质性可能受到气候变率、地形效应以及不同水文单元的影响，这些因素会影响融水如何对海平面上升或局部凹陷作出贡献。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the manual digitization of glacier outlines be preferred over automated methods in certain glacial studies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在某些冰川研究中，手动数字化冰川轮廓可能比自动方法更受青睐的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Manual digitization allows for greater accuracy in delineating debris-free ice, using high-quality imagery and expert validation processes, which might not be possible with automated methods that may struggle with debris cover or cloud and snow interference.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 手动数字化可以更准确地划定无碎片冰面，利用高质量的影像和专家验证过程，而这些可能是自动化方法所无法实现的，因为自动化方法可能在处理碎片覆盖或云层和雪的干扰时遇到困难。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of using multiple data sources and manual interpretation for glacier data extraction on the Tibetan Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您将如何评估在青藏高原上使用多个数据源和手动解释进行冰川数据提取的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of multiple data sources such as Landsat imagery, SRTM DEM, and Google Earth, combined with manual interpretation, is generally considered effective for glacier data extraction. The integration of these varied data sources helps in accounting for factors like mountain shadows and seasonal snow, enhancing the accuracy of the glacier outlines. However, the process requires significant human expertise and labor, which can be a limitation in terms of efficiency and scalability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用多种数据源，如Landsat影像、SRTM数字高程模型（DEM）和谷歌地球，结合人工解译，通常被认为是提取冰川数据的有效方法。这些不同数据源的整合有助于考虑诸如山影和季节性雪等因素，从而提高冰川轮廓的准确性。然而，这一过程需要大量的人力专业知识和劳动，这在效率和可扩展性方面可能成为一个限制。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise from excluding debris-covered areas in glacier delineation, and how could these affect the understanding of glacier changes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在冰川划界中排除覆盖碎石的区域可能会出现哪些挑战，这些挑战如何影响对冰川变化的理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Excluding debris-covered areas can lead to underestimation of glacier extent and may not fully capture the dynamics of glacier changes. This exclusion could affect the understanding of glacier mass balance and hydrological contributions, as debris-covered glaciers may have different melting patterns. Accurately delineating these areas remains challenging due to the difficulty in distinguishing debris-covered ice from surrounding terrain using remote sensing imagery alone.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 排除覆盖碎石的区域可能导致对冰川范围的低估，并可能无法全面捕捉冰川变化的动态。这种排除可能会影响对冰川质量平衡和水文贡献的理解，因为覆盖碎石的冰川可能具有不同的融化模式。准确划定这些区域仍然具有挑战性，因为仅使用遥感影像很难区分覆盖碎石的冰与周围地形。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, what potential improvements or innovations could enhance the accuracy and efficiency of glacier inventory updates in High Mountain Asia?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在我看来，哪些潜在的改进或创新可以提高高山亚洲冰川清单更新的准确性和效率？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Potential improvements could include the utilization of higher-resolution satellite imagery and the application of machine learning techniques for automated delineation of glacier outlines. Combining multi-temporal datasets with advanced algorithms could help overcome challenges of cloud cover and seasonal variations. Additionally, integrating in-situ data and leveraging crowd-sourced validations could further refine the accuracy and reliability of glacier inventories.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 潜在的改进包括利用更高分辨率的卫星影像和应用机器学习技术进行冰川轮廓的自动划分。结合多时相数据集与先进算法可以帮助克服云层覆盖和季节变化带来的挑战。此外，整合现场数据和利用众包验证可以进一步提高冰川清单的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how a dataset on glacier changes across the Tibetan Plateau can achieve high precision when dealing with snow and cloud cover.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白关于青藏高原冰川变化的数据集在处理雪和云层覆盖时如何能够实现高精度。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The glacier outlines were digitized manually with guidance from SRTM DEM and Google Earth imagery to ensure accuracy. High-quality images with minimal cloud and snow coverage were selected for delineation. The manual delineation was validated and edited by different operators multiple times to enhance precision.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 冰川轮廓是通过参考SRTM数字高程模型和谷歌地球影像手动数字化的，以确保准确性。选择了云层和雪覆盖较少的高质量影像进行划定。手动划定经过不同操作员多次验证和编辑，以提高精确度。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how multiple operators working over several years can ensure consistent data quality in glacier mapping.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解多个操作人员在多年内如何确保冰川制图的一致数据质量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The delineated glacier outlines were validated and edited by different operators at least three times by overlaying them onto imagery, DEMs, and maps, ensuring consistent data quality. This collaborative approach, combined with expert review, contributes to maintaining accuracy and reliability in the data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 划定的冰川轮廓经过不同操作员至少三次验证和编辑，通过将其叠加在影像、数字高程模型（DEM）和地图上，确保数据质量的一致性。这种协作方法结合专家审查，有助于保持数据的准确性和可靠性。
